name: Base Hacking Kit V2
effect: Your Mech gains the ability to use basic hacking functions
description: Made to give basic hacking actions in Foundry

actions.name: BOLSTER
actions.detail: When you BOLSTER, you use your mech’s formidable processing power to enhance another character’s systems. To BOLSTER, choose a character within SENSORS. They receive +2 Accuracy on the next skill check or save they make between now and the end of their next turn. Characters can only benefit from one BOLSTER at a time.

actions.name: SCAN
actions.detail: When you SCAN, you use your mech’s powerful sensors to perform a deep scan on an enemy. To SCAN, choose a character or object within SENSORS and line of sight, then ask the GM for one of the following pieces of information, which they must answer honestly: 1. Your target’s weapons, systems, and full statistics (HP, SPEED, EVASION, ARMOR, MECH SKILLS, and so on). 2. One piece of hidden information about the target, such as confidential cargo or data, current mission, the identity of the pilot, and so on. 3. Generic or public information about the target that can be pulled from an info bank or records, such as the model number of a mech. Any information gathered is only current at the time of the SCAN – if the target later takes damage, for instance, you don’t receive an update.

actions.name: Lock On
actions.detail: When you LOCK ON, you digitally mark a target, lighting them up for your teammates’ targeting systems and exposing weak points. To LOCK ON, choose a character within SENSORS and line of sight. They gain the LOCK ON condition.

actions.name: Fragment Signal
actions.detail:
You feed false information, obscene messages, or phantom signals to your target’s computing core. They become IMPAIRED and SLOWED until the end of their next turn.
[Feeding false truths to the enemy]

name: Remote Ancillary Armor Repairer (RAAR)
effect: Restores armor HP using stored repair charges. Requires repair capacity for a full recharge.
description: Designed and manufactured by Steel Core, the Remote Ancillary Armor Repairer (RAAR) employs advanced drone technology to provide real-time armor repairs from a distance. Originally developed for Steel Core's specialized units like the Thalia, this system enhances combat resilience by allowing mechs to receive quick repairs while remaining engaged in battle.

actions.name: Remote Repair
actions.detail: Target an allied mech within range 12. That mech regains 1d4+2 HP.

actions.name: Restock
actions.detail: Consume 1 repair capacity and regain all charges

name: Integrity Response Drones System (IRDS)
effect: Deploy a drone to either yourself or an allied mech within range 4. The Drone will automaticly repair allies nearby.
description: Developed by Steel Core Manufacuring (STC) as a quick-deployment repair tool, the Integrity Response Drones (IRD) were designed to patch up damaged mechs on the battlefield without the need for a dedicated mechanic or support unit. These drones are popular among smaller strike teams that can’t afford dedicated healers. Pirate groups such as the Guristas Pirates have also adapted this technology for rapid repairs during hit-and-run engagements.

deployables.name: Integrity Response Drone
deployables.detail: In a Burst 1 Area friendly mechs gain 1d4+4 HP at the start of their turn.

actions.name: Activate WABU
actions.init: Must not be stunned, Immobilized, jammed or grappled.
actions.trigger: Ally takes structure damage within range 8
actions.detail: You may move up to the ally giving +1 difficulty to any engagements and any overwatch reactions. Once at the ally give them 10 over shield possibly negating any further damage.

name: 3D Parts Printer
effect:
• During a short repair you can expend a charge on yourself or for an ally to fully repair HP or Structure and a System or Weapon.
  • During a short rest you can expend 2 charges charge on yourself or for an ally to do a full repair.
  • This system is not allowed to regain charges till the end of the mission. unless you use the supply drop from the talent Grease Monkey Rank III. No other rule superceeds this.

name: Damage Control
effect: When you loose a structure you may choose to activate the following effect: Ignore the effect from losing a structure before the structure die is cast. Once this has been activated mark the damage control as destroyed.
description:
CAN NOT BE RUN WITH OTHER DAMAGE CONTROL'S OR THE Emergency Repair Module

actions.name: Activate assault damage control
actions.detail: Once activated the damage control gives the user resistance to Kinetic and Explosive damage for 2 Rounds. Gain 5 HEAT once you activate this.

name: Interception Protocol
effect: As a Reaction, when an ally within Sensor Range is targeted by an attack and has Lock On, your mech can force the attack to target yourself instead.

actions.name: Activate Interception Protocol
actions.trigger: When an enemy attacks an ally and the enemy uses lock on thats on the ally.
actions.detail: You may get attacked instead, having the enemy do an attack roll on you.

name: Intergrated Jump Jets
effect: As a Quick Action, you may jump up to 2 spaces in any direction, including vertically. Upon landing, all characters (enemies and allies) adjacent to you centered on your landing spot must pass a Hull save or be knocked Prone. This movement does not provoke reactions
description: These GMS-designed jump jets enable high-impact tactical mobility, allowing mechs to reposition without fear of retaliation. Upon landing, the shockwave from the impact destabilizes surrounding units, making it an invaluable tool for disrupting enemy formations or covering quick retreats.
